An injury done to a lance in an encounter, without its being broken; also, a breaking of a lance in an encounter in a dishonorable or unscientific manner.
The perineum.
To contaminate or corrupt (something) with an external agent, either physically or morally.
To spoil (food) by contamination.
To be infected or corrupted; to be touched by something corrupting.
To be affected with incipient putrefaction.
definitions.example: Meat soon taints in warm weather.

definitions.definition: To mark (a variable) as unsafe, so that operations involving it are subject to additional security checks.
To invalidate (a share capital account) by transferring profits into it.
To damage, as a lance, without breaking it; also, to break, as a lance, but usually in an unknightly or unscientific manner.
To hit or touch lightly, in tilting.
To thrust ineffectually with a lance.
A series of events used as a rough measure of duration.
To relax; to spend time lazily; to stand, sit, or recline, in an indolent manner.
The act of one who lounges.
The state of being predisposed or susceptible to something, especially to a disease or other health problem
To annoy.
definitions.example: Don’t bug me, I’m busy!

definitions.definition: To install an electronic listening device or devices in.
definitions.example: We need to know what’s going on. We’ll bug his house.

definitions.definition: Electronic surveillance.
Externally or on the outside, or on the surface.
definitions.example: The terrorist was outwardly a bank clerk.

definitions.definition: Toward the outside
Characterized by loud, confused noise.
Causing or characterized by tumult; chaotic, disorderly, turbulent.
Symbiotic star
Of, or relating to symbiosis; living together.
definitions.example: A lichen is a fungus with symbiotic algae among its cells.

definitions.definition: Of a relationship with mutual benefit between two individuals or organisms.
A person who has dyslexia.
Of or pertaining to dyslexia.
Having dyslexia.
A forked bone between the neck and breast of a bird consisting chiefly of the two clavicles fused at their median or lower end, regarded as a lucky charm in some countries.
A spar in two parts, between which a sail is hoisted, the wishbone extending its clew.
Any sailing vessel rigged with a wishbone.
A particular kind of offensive formation. See wishbone formation.
One who oversees or supervises.
A critic.
The top of a ridge.
The spine of an animal.
A piece of the backbone of an animal, with the adjoining parts, cut for cooking.
A sharp angle in the cross section of a hull.
A hollowed or bevelled channel in the waterway of a ship's deck.
The edge or rim of a cask, etc., formed by the projecting ends of the staves; the chamfered end of a stave.
The back of the blade on a scythe.
(Southern England) A steep-sided ravine leading from the top of a cliff down to the sea.
To cut through the backbone of; to cut into chine pieces.
To chamfer the ends of a stave and form the chine.
To crack, split, fissure, break.
definitions.example: A drought had caused the earth to chine and cranny.

definitions.definition: One who cries.
An officer who proclaims the orders or directions of a court, or who gives public notice by loud proclamation, such as a town crier.
To give a formal (usually written) authorization.
definitions.example: It was decided to license Wikipedia under the GFDL.

definitions.definition: Authorize officially.
definitions.example: I am licensed to practice law in this state.

definitions.definition: (of a person or enterprise) having been issued with a licence (by the required authority)
definitions.example: Only licensed exterminators can purchase rat poison in this state.

definitions.definition: (of an activity) authorized by licence
definitions.example: Even licensed fishing has a major effect on the fish population in the river.

definitions.definition: A collaboration, especially a work produced by several musicians who do not usually work together.
To collaborate.
To bring into contact with a substance that causes illness (a pathogen).
definitions.example: Not everyone will be infected when an epidemic strikes.

definitions.definition: To make somebody enthusiastic about one's own passion.
definitions.example: Her passion for dancing has infected me.

definitions.definition: The act of penetrating something.
definitions.example: Any penetration, however slight, is sufficient to complete the offense.

definitions.definition: Specifically, the insertion of the penis (or similar object) during sexual intercourse.
The act of penetrating a given situation with the mind or faculties; perception, discernment.
A number or fraction that represents how many cards/decks will be dealt before shuffling, in contrast to the total number of cards/decks in play.
The proportion of the target audience who buy the advertised product or service.
Any of many South African flowering plants, of the genus Protea, having colourful cone-shaped flower heads.
Any polymer derived from a vinyl compound.
Composed of, or derived from, many vinyl groups
An encapsulated collection of nerve-cell bodies, located outside the brain and spinal cord.
Any of certain masses of gray matter in the brain, as the basal ganglia.
(by extension) A centre of intellectual or industrial force, activity, etc.
A cystic tumour on a tendon sheath or joint capsule; a ganglion cyst.
The middle part, cavity, or belly of a sail; the part of a furled sail which is at the center of the yard.
definitions.example: The bunt of the sail was green.

definitions.definition: A push or shove; a butt.

A ball that has been intentionally hit softly so as to be difficult to field, sometimes with a hands-spread batting stance or with a close-hand, choked-up hand position. No swinging action is involved.
definitions.example: The bunt was fielded cleanly.

definitions.definition: The act of bunting.
definitions.example: The manager will likely call for a bunt here.

definitions.definition: The second half of an outside loop, from level flight to inverted flight.
A fungus (Ustilago foetida) affecting the ear of cereals, filling the grains with a foetid dust; pepperbrand.
To push with the horns; to butt.
To spring or rear up.
To intentionally hit softly with a hands-spread batting stance.
definitions.example: Jones bunted the ball.

definitions.definition: To intentionally hit a ball softly with a hands-spread batting stance.
definitions.example: Jones bunted.

definitions.definition: To perform (the second half of) an outside loop.
definitions.example: We had heard that there was an elite group of three or four pilots in Jodhpur called the "Bunt Club", who had successfully bunted their aircraft - that is, carried out the second half of an outside loop. In the Bunt, you pushed the nose down, past the vertical and still further, until you were in horizontal inverted flight, and came out on the other side and rolled it out.

definitions.definition: To swell out.
definitions.example: The sail bunts.

definitions.definition: (of a cat) To headbutt affectionately.
To separate or break down something into its components; to disintegrate or fragment
To rot, decay or putrefy
Unable to be imagined; inconceivable or mind-boggling; beyond belief
A species of great ape in the genus Pan, native to Africa, and believed by biologists to be the closest extant relative to humans.
(of a wet or greasy surface) To reflect light with a glittering luster; to sparkle, coruscate, glint or flash.
The appearance of something that glistens.
A fluid-filled microvacuole within a lens.

A sign (ء‎ - a stand-alone hamza) used in the written Arabic language representing a glottal stop. Hamza may appear as a stand-alone letter or most commonly diacritically over or under other letters, e.g. أ‎ (over an alif - ا‎), إ‎ (under an alif), ؤ‎ (over a wāw - و‎) or ئ‎ (over a dotless yāʾ - ى‎). The exact seat of hamza is governed by an orthographic rule - "seat of hamza rule".
The light of the moon; moonlight.
High-proof alcohol (especially whiskey) that is often, but not always, produced illegally.
definitions.example: They watered down the moonshine.

definitions.definition: Nonsense.
definitions.example: He was talking moonshine.

definitions.definition: A branch of pure mathematics relating the Monster group to an invariant of elliptic functions.
A spiced dish of eggs and fried onions.
A month.
An SI unit of length equal to 10-2 metres. Symbol: cm
To discharge material (including waste products) from a cell, body or system.
Careless, hasty writing, doodle or drawing
To write or draw carelessly and in a hurry
To doodle
To card or tease (wool) coarsely; to run through a scribbler.
Brassica rapa subsp. pekinensis, a kind of Chinese cabbage.
A festival open to the public, the proceeds from which are often given to charity.
A feast, celebration or carnival.
(usually in the passive) To celebrate (a person).
The quality or state of being peculiar; individuality; singularity.
definitions.example: The peculiarity of meeting six people on a usually deserted trail only struck me later on.

definitions.definition: That which is peculiar; a special and distinctive characteristic or habit; particularity.
Exclusive possession or right.
(of medicine) Not requiring a prescription; over-the-counter.

A device using gunpowder and other chemicals which, when lit, emits a combination of coloured flames, sparks, whistles or bangs, and sometimes made to rocket high into the sky before exploding, used for entertainment or celebration.
definitions.example: Commercial firework displays are commonly launched from boats or other vessels

definitions.definition: To make local; to fix in, or assign to, a definite place.
To adapt a product for use in a particular country or region, typically by translating text into the language of that country and modifying currencies, date formats, etc.
definitions.example: We need to localize our software for the Japanese market.

definitions.definition: To determine where something takes place or is to be found.
In a favourable manner.
definitions.example: She looked favourably on people who gave freely their assistance.

definitions.definition: To surround or hem in.
(sometimes figurative) To attack or assail, especially from all sides.
To decorate something with jewels etc.
Of a ship, to get trapped by ice.
A charge taken on bets, as by a bookie or gambling establishment.
The interest on a loan of money, especially for loans made by a usurer or loan shark.
An amount owed on account of or payment of a bookie's charge or of interest.
A commission or similar extra charge.
In an involuntary manner; done without conscious thought.
definitions.example: He involuntarily overheard the conversation.

definitions.definition: To hit with one's chest (front of one's body)
To deposit in a chest.
To place in a coffin.
(usually in combination) Having a chest (with a specified quality).
definitions.example: Jenny was the most flat-chested of her friends.

definitions.definition: The fleshy yellow root of a variety of rape, Brassica napus var. napobrassica, resembling a large turnip, grown as a vegetable.
The plant from which this is obtained.
The turnip.
The head.
To produce a low-budget remake of a film without the use of professional actors or filming techniques.
Of, or relating to hot water.
Of or relating to emanations of hot water that are rich in minerals, or to the rocks formed from them.
A rod bent into a curved shape, typically with one end free and the other end secured to a rope or other attachment.
A barbed metal hook used for fishing; a fishhook.
Any of various hook-shaped agricultural implements such as a billhook.
The curved needle used in the art of crochet.
The part of a hinge which is fixed to a post, and on which a door or gate hangs and turns.
A loop shaped like a hook under certain written letters, for example, g and j.
A tie-in to a current event or trend that makes a news story or editorial relevant and timely.
A snare; a trap.
(in the plural) The projecting points of the thighbones of cattle; called also hook bones.
Removal or expulsion from a group or activity

definitions.definition: A field sown two years in succession.
(authorship) A brief, punchy opening statement intended to get attention from an audience, reader, or viewer, and make them want to continue to listen to a speech, read a book, or watch a play.
(authorship) A gimmick or element of a creative work intended to be attention-grabbing for the audience; a compelling idea for a story that will be sure to attract people's attention.
A finesse.
A jack (the playing card).
A spit or narrow cape of sand or gravel turned landward at the outer end, such as Sandy Hook in New Jersey.
A catchy musical phrase which forms the basis of a popular song.
definitions.example: The song's hook snared me.

definitions.definition: A ship's anchor.
Part of a system's operation that can be intercepted to change or augment its behaviour.
definitions.example: We've added hooks to allow undefined message types to be handled with custom code.

definitions.definition: (Scrabble) An instance of playing a word perpendicular to a word already on the board, adding a letter to the start or the end of the word to form a new word.
A diacritical mark shaped like the upper part of a question mark, as in ỏ.
A háček.
Senses relating to sports.
Something contrived or artificial.

One who discovers: a person who has discovered something.
Soup noodles of wheat, with various ingredients (Japanese style)

(Pastafarianism) amen

definitions.definition: To license under a copyleft license.

definitions.definition: To provide with, usually for a specific purpose.

definitions.definition: To cut into or between; to cut or cross mutually; to divide into parts.

definitions.definition: Of two sets, to have at least one element in common.
A player of the highest rank, as determined by FIDE, with an Elo rating of at least 2500.
A master in a field, whose skills or accomplishments exceed those of other masters.

definitions.definition: This organ, as taken from animals used as food.

definitions.definition: A dark brown colour, tinted with red and gray, like the colour of liver.
Someone who lives (usually in a specified way).
The writing of history; a written history.
The study of the discipline and practice of history and the writings of past historians.

Glass marble.
Of or like glass, especially in being smooth and somewhat reflective.
Including a lot of glass.
Dull; expressionless.

definitions.definition: (of water) Lacking any chop; smooth and mostly flat.
Any of a variety of related species of generally dark-colored catfish in the family Ictaluridae.

A fish of species Gobiomorphus gobioides.
An obstinate person.

A chronograph (watch or stopwatch) with two push buttons arranged like the horns of a bull on the top end of the case, typically with the crown between them.
To speak ambiguously or enigmatically.
To solve, answer, or explicate a riddle or question.

definitions.example: You have to riddle the gravel before you lay it on the road.

definitions.definition: To fill with holes like a riddle.

definitions.definition: To fill or spread throughout; to pervade.

Damaged throughout by holes.

Possessing financial wealth; rich.

Sharp or keen to the senses.

To divide into two halves.
To make up half of.

Appearing as if one side were cut away.
The national currency of Vanuatu.
The fleshy yellow root of a variety of rape, Brassica napus var. napobrassica, resembling a large turnip, grown as a vegetable.

The unplowed boundary of a field.
One of the four competitions in a knockout tournament whose winners go on to play in the two semifinals.
A person who is interested in an activity or a subject as a hobby.

definitions.definition: One who agitates; one who stirs up or excites others, for example political reformers.
An implement for shaking or mixing.
One of a body of men appointed by the army, in Cromwell's time, to look after their interests; called also adjutators.
Of an organism in which both copies of a given gene have the same allele
An instrument or device for domestic use, especially in the kitchen.
definitions.example: We have convenient storage for all the kitchen utensils.

definitions.definition: A useful small tool, implement, or vessel.
definitions.example: He stocked up on old-style writing utensils.

definitions.definition: The Afrikaner people.
A grouping of smaller peoples or tribes as a nation.
The inhabitants of a region, especially the native inhabitants.
(plural: folks) One’s relatives, especially one’s parents.
Folk music.
People in general.
definitions.example: Young folk, old folk, everybody come, / To our little Sunday School and have a lot of fun.

definitions.definition: A particular group of people.
The state of a glowing object.
The condition of being passionate or having warm feelings.
The brilliance or warmth of color in an environment or on a person (especially one's face).

definitions.definition: To give off light from heat or to emit light as if heated.
definitions.example: The fire was still glowing after ten hours.

definitions.definition: To radiate some emotional quality like light.

definitions.definition: To gaze especially passionately at something.
To radiate thermal heat.

definitions.definition: To shine brightly and steadily.

definitions.definition: To make hot; to flush.
To feel hot; to have a burning sensation, as of the skin, from friction, exercise, etc.; to burn.
To make high; to raise higher; to elevate.
To advance, increase, augment, make larger, more intense, stronger etc.

definitions.definition: To go beyond, especially in a metaphoric or technical manner; to exceed.
definitions.example: The former problem student surpassed his instructor's expectations and scored top marks on his examination.

definitions.definition: The act or process by which something is surpassed; a bettering.
Becoming superior to others; becoming excellent; exceptional; exceeding.
To make a din, to resound.
(of a place) To be filled with sound, to resound.
To assail (a person, the ears) with loud noise.
To repeat continuously, as though to the point of deafening or exhausting somebody.
The sound or action of making a loud noise or commotion.
An ill-fitting garment.
A failure to fit well; unsuitability, disparity.
A badly adjusted person; someone unsuitable or set apart because of their habits, behaviour etc.

definitions.definition: To fit badly.

definitions.definition: A deep-bowled spoon with a long, usually curved, handle.

An instrument for drawing the charge of a cannon.

To pour or serve something with a ladle.
definitions.example: One man ladled molten steel into the shot sleeve.

definitions.definition: Capable or worthy of being quoted
